00032 // Interface for Float32 type.
00033 //
00034 // 3/22/9 jhrg9
00035 
00036 #ifndef _float32_h
00037 #define _float32_h 1
00038 
00039 #ifndef __POWERPC__
00040 #ifdef __GNUG__
00041 #pragma interface
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #if 0
00046 
00047 #ifdef WIN32
00048 #include <rpc.h>
00049 #include <winsock.h>
00050 #include <xdr.h>
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #include <rpc/types.h>
00054 #include <netinet/in.h>

00057 
00058 #ifndef _dods_datatypes_h
00059 #include "dods-datatypes.h"
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 #ifndef _basetype_h
00063 #include "BaseType.h"
00064 #endif
00065 
00070 class Float32: public BaseType {
00077     friend class Byte;
00078     friend class Int16;
00079     friend class UInt16;
00080     friend class Int32;
00081     friend class UInt32;
00082     friend class Float64;
00083 
00084 protected:
00085     dods_float32 _buf;
00086 
00087 public:
00088     Float32(const string &n = "");
00089 
00090     Float32(const Float32 &copy_from);
00091 
00092     Float32 &operator=(const Float32 &rhs);
00093 
00094     virtual ~Float32() {}
00095 
00096     virtual BaseType *ptr_duplicate();
00097     
00098     virtual unsigned int width();
00099 
00100     virtual bool serialize(const string &dataset, DDS &dds, XDR *sink,
00101                bool ce_eval = true);
00102     virtual bool deserialize(XDR *source, DDS *dds, bool reuse = false);
00103 
00104     virtual unsigned int val2buf(void *val, bool reuse = false);
00105     virtual unsigned int buf2val(void **val);
00106 
00107     virtual dods_float32 value();
00108 
00109     virtual void print_val(ostream &os, string space = "", 
00110                bool print_decl_p = true);
00111 
00112     virtual void print_val(FILE *out, string space = "", 
00113                bool print_decl_p = true);
00114 
00115     virtual bool ops(BaseType *b, int op, const string &dataset);
00116 };

00160 // Revision 1.14  2001/08/24 17:46:22  jimg
00161 // Resolved conflicts from the merge of release 3.2.6
00162 //
00163 // Revision 1.13.4.1  2001/07/28 01:10:42  jimg
00164 // Some of the numeric type classes did not have copy ctors or operator=.
00165 // I added those where they were needed.
00166 // In every place where delete (or delete []) was called, I set the pointer
00167 // just deleted to zero. Thus if for some reason delete is called again
00168 // before new memory is allocated there won't be a mysterious crash. This is
00169 // just good form when using delete.
00170 // I added calls to www2id and id2www where appropriate. The DAP now handles
00171 // making sure that names are escaped and unescaped as needed. Connect is
00172 // set to handle CEs that contain names as they are in the dataset (see the
00173 // comments/Log there). Servers should not handle escaping or unescaping
00174 // characters on their own.
00175 //
00176 // Revision 1.13  2000/09/22 02:17:20  jimg
00177 // Rearranged source files so that the CVS logs appear at the end rather than
00178 // the start. Also made the ifdef guard symbols use the same naming scheme and
00179 // wrapped headers included in other headers in those guard symbols (to cut
00180 // down on extraneous file processing - See Lakos).
00181 //
00182 // Revision 1.12  2000/09/21 16:22:07  jimg
00183 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00184 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00185 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00186 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00187 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00188 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
00189 //
